content: Defunct Asian pay television channel (1997-2019)Television channel **Diva** (formerly **Diva Universal**) was an English-language [pay television](/wiki/Pay_television) channel in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It launched on 30 November 1997 as Hallmark Channel, along with [E!](/wiki/E!_(Asian_TV_channel)) to viewers across [Southeast Asia](/wiki/Southeast_Asia) and [ASEAN](/wiki/ASEAN). In 2010, the channel was renamed Diva Universal and then Diva in 2014. It closed on 1 January 2020, after 22 years of broadcasting in anticipation of the launch of the streaming service [Hayu](/wiki/Hayu_(streaming_service)) in the region after the channel space created in 2001 by Hallmark Channel ceased to exist. ## History Hallmark Channel Asia was launched on 30 November 1997 with [E!](/wiki/E!_(Asian_TV_channel)). It had four different feeds including the Philippine one, which was launched on 19 August 2009. Hallmark Channel Asia was rebranded as **Diva Universal** on 19 September 2010, after its [brand licensing](/wiki/Brand_licensing) agreement with [Crown Media](/wiki/Crown_Media) ended, as part of Universal Networks International's efforts to refocus its network portfolio. Coinciding with the launch of its high-definition feed, the SD channel started broadcasting in 16:9 [widescreen](/wiki/Widescreen) on 1 February 2014. On 16 June 2014, Diva Universal's name was simplified to **Diva**. On 28 January 2015, the HD version of Diva was launched. ### Closure. As part of a restructuring at [NBCUniversal International Networks](/wiki/NBCUniversal_International_Networks) and the officially formal full launch of [Hayu](/wiki/Hayu_(streaming_service)) in [Asia](/wiki/Asia) on at stroke of midnight [New Year's Day](/wiki/New_Year%27s_Day) (/wiki/2020_in_Singapore), Diva along with its sister channel [E! Entertainment Television](/wiki/E!_(Asian_TV_channel)) officially ceased broadcasting and transmission after very final and last programme being [About Time](/wiki/About_Time_(2013_film)) after the officially closing ceremony being held at [Universal Studios Singapore](/wiki/Universal_Studios_Singapore) with the station ident/logo of DIVA Be Yourself and the [vocal national anthem](/wiki/Majulah_Singapura) was played with [Singapore English](/wiki/Singapore_English)/[Singlish](/wiki/Singlish) translated subtitles and [laserdisc](/wiki/Laserdisc) label by Kowloon Video Pte Ltd. After the closure of Diva, it fades to black screen for two minutes until the closure message for providers that broadcast the channel. Indonesian provider broadcast this message "THIS CHANNEL HAS BEEN CEASED BROADCAST. PLEASE CONTACT YOUR SERVICE PROVIDER FOR DETAILS". All Diva shows were moved to [CNBC Asia](/wiki/CNBC_Asia). NBCUniversal channels in Asia retained [DreamWorks](/wiki/DreamWorks_Channel), [CNBC Asia](/wiki/CNBC_Asia) and [Golf Channel](/wiki/Golf_Channel). ## Former operating channels - **Diva Asia** - Available in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), [Kuala Lumpur](/wiki/Kuala_Lumpur), [Manila](/wiki/Manila), [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong), [Taipei](/wiki/Taipei), [Bangkok](/wiki/Bangkok), [Jakarta](/wiki/Jakarta), [Hanoi](/wiki/Hanoi) and [Ho Chi Minh City](/wiki/Ho_Chi_Minh_City) in SD format. - **Diva Asia HD** - Same as the Asian feed, available in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia), [Philippines](/wiki/Philippines), [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong), [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia), [Thailand](/wiki/Thailand), [Taiwan](/wiki/Taiwan) and [Vietnam](/wiki/Vietnam). - [Diva Universal](/wiki/Diva_Universal) in various countries - Official website
title: Diva (Asian TV channel)
